scenario_text.value: Ungh!
You okay?

(The professor is struggling to get up...
He’s desperate to find Saki and Shuuji.)
(What should I say to him?)
Please take it easy!
We’re counting on you!
Leave it to us!

Are you okay? Your injuries are serious.
You need to take it easy...

We need to be worried about those two, not
me. We have to hurry up and help!
We’ve been looking for them, too.
But we can’t find them anywhere...
I guess, in that case, they must have...
I hate to say, but we’re counting on you!
We need your help to save Saki and Shuuji.
Please!

But of course.
That would be my role as an adult.
Where did you see them last?
Ah... Let’s see...

Leave it to us to find them.
You need to rest.
I’ll find ’em!

That’s no good. It’s my fault that those
children were left behind.
And do you even know where they may be?
Umm, that’s...

Let me help with this.
Where I last saw them...

Let’s see, I lost sight of Saki and Shuuji
around here...
It was somewhere in this forest... ugh!
Professor! Are you okay?

Yeah, I’m...I’m fine.
My memories are still fuzzy.

I’m sure it was somewhere close by when we
were attacked and separated.

I last saw them somewhere close by.
Let’s hurry.
